reviews.review_msg: Good professor but seriously, 80% for a paper is a bit too much if you ask me.

Dr. Perl is a very knowledgeable professor. He is caring and humorous. Dr. Perl provides clear and helpful feedback in assignments and during 1 on 1 consultations to assist students in better understanding the criteria required to earn a better mark. Despite only receiving a B (personal reasons), the course is as expected for a 400 Writing course.

Dr. Perl is an excellet prof. I would call him the "Transport Supremo" because he is one of the expert in the world in the area of transportation. If you are interested in transportation research then he is the one. He puts practice and theory perfectly, and has a unique way of assessing students. My highest recommendation for Dr. Perl.

Very straightforward class, Perl clearly and simply laid out the concepts of the course and the marking was fair. If you participate and grasp the main concepts of the course you will likely do well. Reading is not necessarily mandatory but it can help. Also watch episodes of Yes Minister which are interesting and cut the monotony of the class.

Anthony Perl is an excellent professor. He is an expert in the policy sciences and is not biased. His class size is small and he runs a tight seminar  If you are the type of student who sits through seminars and never says anything, do everyone else a favour and don't take this class.

Awesome prof, would highly recommend to anyone.  A tad wordy for take home mid terms and finals, they tend to be fair and interesting.  At the end of each lecture we watched an episode of Yes, Minister, funny and surprisingly well connected to the topics discussed.  Perl ties modern policy problems together with readings to show the applicability.

One of the most accessible and informative professors you'll find. Not an easy A but you can get a great grade if you're willing to work. I would just be careful not to to take too many intensive classes alongside one of Dr. Hira's upper division classes.

You either love him or you hate him.  There is no inbetween.  Be prepared to work hard.  Slackers will fail.  As long as you put in the work every day, he will make it worth your while.  Extremely helpful when you go see him in his office.  He has a very understated sense of humor.  I would recommend him personally.
